lead_paragraph: The commando attack occurred at a village 40 miles west of Mogadishu on Tuesday night, with the help of American military advisers and helicopters.

byline.contributor: Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Jeffrey Gettleman from Lubumbashi, Democratic Republic of Congo.

headline.print_headline: Somalia Raid Aided by U.S. Kills Fighters From Shabab
headline.main: Somalia Raid Aided by U.S. Kills Fighters From Shabab

snippet: The commando attack occurred at a village 40 miles west of Mogadishu on Tuesday night, with the help of American military advisers and helicopters.
abstract: Somali officials say joint raid carried out by Somali troops and American Special Operations forces on Shabab base in Shabelle region has left 19 militants dead; raid, which followed American air strike on training camp, is indication that United States is increasing frequency of strikes against militant group.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
